page.title: 19HEALTH IN PANTON
page.content: {PANTON}is a very isolated hamlet and as such the health of its inhabitants will depend on available services being reached quickly and efficiently. Most residents of {PANTON}are in the care of a doctor either at Wragby or East Barkwith and surgeries are held daily.Doctors will visit if requested and if weather permits. Last year the elderly mother of one resident was dying and the doctor warned that the visit he had just made would probably be the last because the road conditions were so bad. A chiropody unit visits Wragby once a month and residents with an appointment have to make their own way there. There is a hospital car service available if a hospital appointment has to be kept and the patient then contributes towards the cost of the transport.
